refnamediv.refpurpose: The ATK interface which provides standard mechanism for manipulating hyperlinks.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "link-selected" void user_function (AtkHypertext *atkhypertext, gint arg1, gpointer user_data);

refsect2.title: struct AtkHypertext
refsect2.para: The AtkHypertext structure does not contain any fields.

refsect2.title: atk_hypertext_get_link ()
refsect2.para: Gets the link in this hypertext document at index link_index

listitem.simpara: an integer specifying the desired link
the link in this hypertext document at index link_index

refsect2.title: atk_hypertext_get_n_links ()
refsect2.para: Gets the number of links within this hypertext document.

listitem.simpara: the number of links within this hypertext document

refsect2.title: atk_hypertext_get_link_index ()
refsect2.para: Gets the index into the array of hyperlinks that is associated with the character specified by char_index, or -1 if there is no hyperlink associated with this character.

listitem.simpara: an index into the array of hyperlinks in hypertext

refsect2.title: The "link-selected" signal
refsect2.para: The "link-selected" signal is emitted by an AtkHyperText object when one of the hyperlinks associated with the object is selected.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
the index of the hyperlink which is selected
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
